origin:
Members of Congress often vote to cut or keep their allowances low.

It‚Äôs a superficial gesture, bc keeping Congressional pay low is what creates the desperation + impetus for good, experienced staff to flee to lobbyist jobs.

Raising staffer pay helps get money out of politics. https://twitter.com/MichaelBKelley/status/1105843738566369280¬†‚Ä¶

Some perspective on entry-level minimum pay raise for @AOC‚Äôs office: About 34% higher than the median for House staff assistants  https://finance.yahoo.com/news/aoc-staff-pay-143357393.html¬†‚Ä¶ by @aarthiswami and @DFosterGraphics  pic.twitter.com/cY0Dxs3yBT
replies:
Same w/ member pay.

Members are paid more than avg - but job reqs 2 residences + we can‚Äôt take tax deductions for work costs.

No one wants to be the one to bring up increases, so instead ppl take advantage of insider trading loopholes & don‚Äôt close them for the extra cash.

Congress‚Äô insider trading problems used to be worse - and the good news is that some laws have been passed to tighten things up a bit.

But there‚Äôs still a lot of work to do:  https://www.bloomberg.com/amp/opinion/articles/2018-08-10/congress-s-guide-to-insider-trading-and-corruption¬†‚Ä¶
This is what happens when someone who has been in our shoes becomes a representative.
She grew up in a rich neighborhood and has never been in your shoes.

She was originally from the Bronx, then her parents moved to a small house in a better neighborhood so she could attend a decent school.  Her family struggled. After her father died, she worked hard as a waitress/bartender to support her mother & brother.

Derek vacillates between "too poor to be qualified to serve" and "too rich to be representative of the working class" as the opportunity presents. In other words, he's a conservative grifter and not worth the time to engage him.
Yes raise staff pay. Cost us more tax dollars. Brilliant.

Maybe on your next podcast you‚Äôll want to cover the Congressional staff budgeting process. You‚Äôre aware they‚Äôre all given the same amount to work with, right? @RepAOC just wants to give them a decent, living wage for the ridiculous hours they work.
I am aware. And on a grand scale it‚Äôs just a drop in the bucket, but it would cost more of our tax dollars.
If each Member of Congress is allotted the same budget for staff how would it cost more tax dollars if Members chose to pay their staffs more out of their set budget?

If a member wanted to spend the whole budget on say, erasers, it would not be used wisely. Same with this case, these are entry level government jobs. Members should be responsible and spend the budget wisely for the tax payer. Otherwise we do not get our money‚Äôs worth.
Paying your staff is part of the reason you're rising above everyone else: https://twitter.com/missmayn/status/1105593158547566592¬†‚Ä¶
Wait. . . paying people well promotes a better work ethic? I don't believe it. Next you'll try to tell me that people who don't struggle to pay their bills are happier and more productive. Hogwash.
Which would be great if it were YOUR money to pay out. Pretty easy to raise their pay with taxpayer (i.e. MY) money

But that's not what is happening.  Each Rep gets a budget to run their office on and they decide how that money is spent, how much is for salaries and how much for travel and how much for poster board, etc.  It does NOT increase your taxes.
Correct - members choose to allocate their budget, and can pay fewer people more money or hire larger staff at lower salaries.
So in conclusion, AOC isn't doing anything that she isn't supposed to do.  She is getting off on the right foot and making sure she has a great staff to work with.  This is proactive and smart.  :-)

From what I read, I believe she took salary from senior staffers who r more qualified & have more responsibilities, cutting their salaries by nearly 1/3 & giving it to the junior staffers. Those senior staffers were depending on those salaries-I guess that‚Äôs her socialism at work

Key thing I want to be sure we all understand is that when a new Member of Congress arrives, they have to hire their staff. So all hiring decisions are by mutual agreement. AOC didn‚Äôt cut anyone‚Äôs salary. She hired for  skill set she wanted to support her and her constituents.
Thank you, AOC. Big supporter and originally from New York. Follow back? ;)
It's easy to be generous with other people's money.
it's easy to hoard it too.

Your hear that, everyone?  Giving politicians more money makes them less corrupt.  

That makes perfect sense. https://twitter.com/AOC/status/1105966706596421633?s=19¬†‚Ä¶
social media policies make names blank

worth noting in some circumstances that does make sense. 

There are multiple states where being a state representative pays literally nothing to below poverty, which means common people cant afford the time to run for such offices, leaving it open only for those that can.
yes, it is other people‚Äôs money. also yes, this seems fair and logical.

Each Rep gets a budget for their staff and can use it as they see fit.  AOC is giving her staff a good salary and cutting back on disposable pens.  And you have a problem with that?  I think you are missing the point.
If you‚Äôre responding to me, I think it is you who are missing the point. I liked her tweet and said the idea seemed ‚Äúfair and logical‚Äù. Am I missing something, or are you?
The "other people's money" thing is what all the trumpets are screaming today so there is that...  Which makes me say How exactly do you think government employees get paid?

Oh yes I forgot that paying people for their work violates everything libertarians stand for!  Deal with it.
#LibertariansAreSilly

What work? What are they producing?
#AnarchoCapitalismIsLiberty

The Congress or the congressional staff? You've never worked in an office, I take it. But many of us have and are aware the amount it works it takes. So don't worry, everything is going just fine. 
ps. Do you have paid work?
#LibertariansAreSilly

Congress creates nothing. They produce nothing of value. Like all government employees (including cops and the military), they are tax leeches.
#AnarchoCapitalismIsLiberty

They produce bills which become laws. They fulfill the requirements of the Constitution by doing their jobs. You are aware of how all this works, right?
#BringBackSchoolHouseRock

That's not ‚Äúproducing‚Äù anything. What good and/or service does Congress provide that has tangible value and can be acquired through voluntary exchange?
#FreeMarketAnarchism

You don't believe that laws add anything of value to our society?  I suggest you try living in Somali for a while.  Let us know how that lawlessness works out for ya, okay?
#LibertarianismIsSilly
Uh...  Somalia is no longer government-less. Try to keep up.
Never was there was just 5 different government's killing each other to see who would get to govern.

Oh yes the idea of war lords fighting it out for control and power... it's just all so medieval and exciting, isn't it?
No, it's not.
#moron

You just described the last 230 years of American history. Maybe you should move to Somalia. 
#Oligarchy
Surprisingly low amount of ‚Äúumms‚Äù and ‚Äúlikes‚Äù in this tweet. I wonder who wrote it?

Honest question, considering the current state of politicians is a full-time job, as expected by the people, do you think you could live in those states on that little of salary without being paycheck-to-paycheck? 
She brings up an honest point. Maybe actually try addressing it?
A congressperson makes about $175,000 a year. They are referring to congressional staffers.
I make more than 175k and I would be very tight maintaining two residences in DC and NY.  Forget about the expectations of appearances as a congressman.

Must be especially tough after having to pay NY state taxes. There‚Äôs no expectation of designer clothes like @aoc has gotten into, but a shower, brushed hair and teeth, ironed clothes and some perfume is kind of expected.
You know the "designer clothes" thing is fake, right
It also allows people who don‚Äôt have extra money from their family to work in these jobs.
If the government had very limited power as it was intended, there would be no money or lobbyists in politics.
Kneeling in Protest of Joy's New Wig

If we had the correct NUMBER OF REPRESENTATIVES (1 per 50K citizens) lobbyists & corporations would catch hell trying to bribe all of them.

See: @AJC4others There is a court case about the # of reps being ILLEGAL. But MSM is not covering it; their OWNERS don't want us to know.

This is law already. That is the lawful reality. This is bringing Corruption to the forefront. It's almost like the universe it's self is opening the doors to lay all bare! As I say EVERYTHING has a breaking point even an atom...and the spirit of the universe.
Pay them so Lobbyist don't have to.

This is a huge point. I think there should be congressional housing, travel, and an expanded budget for a proper staff of experts, so lobbyists stop being the experts. I also think congress should have a higher salary. This should be a plank in the platform.
Kneeling in Protest of Joy's New Wig

No. We need the proper NUMBER OF REPS. We don't even have ONE TENTH of what the constitution demands. A small number is easier to bribe...

See: @AJC4others It's a real court case, but MSM is silent.

We have one rep for 700,000 people.  I'm not even so sure that we need these folks to actually be in Washington. They should be located in their state representing 220k residents. Virtual meetings can cover hearings and voting can be handled that way as well.
Exactly.  Keep them in the district of the people who voted for them and make them accountable for all the bull shit they promised but don‚Äôt deliver.

If my understanding is correct, raising your lower level staff‚Äôs pay, and keeping your chief of staff‚Äôs pay at 80k prevents him from having to make certain financial disclosures. Sounds like a win-win for them.
Your chief of staff is one of the cofounders of @justicedems I‚Äôm sure there‚Äôs $$$$ somewhere!
Yes he is rich. He made his money in a Silicon Valley tech start up. So why is he working for $80k? It‚Äôs because he‚Äôs the boss.
AOC works for him. He tells her what to say, how to vote. He created her. She is only in Congress because he picked her to be the candidate. She is essentially an actress reading his script.
Your rate is fair. Very hard to live in DC on only $30k. Those other numbers are crazy
Hard to live on 52k. After taxes and deductions on your paycheck it's closer to 40s.
In Florida the average is about $26k. It's almost impossible.
You need a math lesson on what ‚Äúaverage‚Äù means and you also need a logic class so you compare two of the same things - not two different things.
No one pays $19/hour that's a lie.

Thank you for making sense. Can we go further and raise pay for all legislators including POTUS in exchange for banning lobbying and accepting speaking fees for several year after their terms, like @AndrewYangVFA is proposing?
52k is barely livable in nyc or dc, none of those other salaries are even remotely workable. I made significantly more than that and still lived paycheck to paycheck in manhattan
Stop buying Starbucks and avocado toast everyday
Even $52k, in America, will get you four walls and not much else.
A lot of us live on a lot less.

why not increase the number of Congresspeople?  With 720,000 people per Congressperson, they are too easy to buy off.  A Congressperson would be more responsive to a district if it were 250,000 people, the ratio most democracies are operating at.

Thought about this as well, I think the number to be looking for is in the 350-450k range. All states end up with at least 2 reps, and it keeps any state from having to create a district that is disproportionately small
Congress and it's staffers are overpaid as it is. Are you kidding me lady, take a hike with members being underpaid!
30K in D.C is over paid? That's barely a living wage.
As a member of Congress, Ms. Cortez annual salary is $174,000. We are not referring to her past employment compensation which was $26,000.
The tweet she's responding to is talking about compensation for staffers.

A woman who doesn't even pay her taxes (which is where the money to pay the staffers comes from) wants to spend more of my tax dollars on them taking food out of my children's mouths pic.twitter.com/EMbx11Y5JK
It's, like, so, you know, easy to be, like, super generous with, like, other people's, like, money, you know?
It's not your money to give. It's stolen income.
She just got in, and is demanding more money? Wow what a swamp rat.
Crazy concept, but in much of the EU we pay public servants well so they are less inclined to be corrupt.
Shhhh, don't tell them about a working system. You scare them!
The EU a working system...are you serious?
The situation with inequality is a lot better. The whole process of law-making is mostly secured. Unlike the US.

Yes because the EU tends to have conversations about inequality as a problem to be solved, rather than being used for political point scoring and victim blaming; and law making is generally accepted to require multi-partisanship and intelligent debate.

The subject is following: US citizen can't imagine a gov that is morally obligated to its population! The fear of tyranny is so great, that the "installment" was captured to benefit only one special class. Everything else is marxism. Highest GDP, yet millions in poverty.

It is odd how we can't pay CEOs enough to "attract talent" no matter how bad they perform but paying regular people more is a mortal sin and will end the world, all according to the same conservatives.

It‚Äôs worse than that the exact same people will make both arguments in back to back statements and not even blink. The mind control is complete the class war is over and the rich already won (paraphrasing W.Buffet)

Yeah, a friend of mine's ex-husband seems to be progressing down the libertarian to what's wrong with white nationalism rabbit hole. It's disturbing to see an otherwise smart person decline like that.

If there is one thing I have learned, when it comes to the boss/employee relationship... Is that if you respect your boss and your job, and are given opportunities to improve, people have a tendency to stay.   Because they believe their work is appreciated.

I implemented this strategy as the leader of my team about 5 years ago, and the results even staggered me.  I watch this video about once a month, to remind myself why. https://www.ted.com/talks/dan_pink_on_motivation?language=en¬†‚Ä¶

All of #AOC staff is paid by the producers

Waiting for when it becomes  illegal to hold stock after writing legislation that boost the very stocks invested in. Divestment from that criminal scheme would go a hella long way to restore trust in this system.  That and make it illegal to swing into similar private sector jobs

Both parties have profited off their offices.
And makes people more reliant on right leaning "Think Tanks" for research.

And it's a decent thing to do, pay people a decent wage.

I 100% agree money has interfered with politics for way too many years. I don‚Äôt get why the U.S governments pockets have so much money for endless war and tax cuts for the rich. What I don‚Äôt get is that the government can afford to pay its own workers.
This a great point that is never discussed. Excellent for your staff as well.
Next she will want a beach house and a jet. Politicians are the scum of the earth.
Crazy thoughts. Actually PAY the people and they will stay and work hard for you. Good job @AOC https://twitter.com/AOC/status/1105966706596421633¬†‚Ä¶

so $50+K is gonna get you a room in shared house.. #winningincome

30k will.  50k will get you a small place in DC.  Nobody goes into gov work to get rich.  Lots of Americans would like to make 25 bucks an hour.

But that's a different discussion.. the sum total of which is they should be.. 
30K is minimum wage in Ontario, for instance.
One would think if you had a University degree and associated debt, the system that suggested a degree equals more economic freedom has failed if that get's you $30K.

This is exactly what happened at the European Parliament. Staff pay was taken out of the hands of individual members and centralised, with big pay increases for the vast majority as a result. Far fewer staff now leave for outside jobs after just a few years than previously.
You have no idea what you‚Äôre trying to say, do you?
Gotta get the money out. It is the single biggest issue in our political field.
I guess your boy toy needs s new car...

I support you paying your staffers well. I know how much these people work. I also know that in many offices they are not paid well or treated with respect. You cannot do your job without strong staff.

I would love to see the actual work done by AOC staffers. I‚Äôm willing to bet it‚Äôs 20 hours max per week ~ $52k

Wow

As a former House and Senate staffer (16 years total), let me assure you that the hours per week are long - 50-60 (unless you are senior management, like chief of staff, in which case...longer). My normal day was 8-6:30, but longer during conferences/budgets/hearings.
Curious. Did you have another job to supplement income?

My wife also has worked (Professor), and like many families needed double income while raising two kids. We are really fortunate - and I am very grateful for chance to serve 23 years in public service.

Geez, you two make Bernie Madoff look like a saint
